summary: Modern, clean, minimal cross-platform (Android/iOS) Music & Video Player app with dark/light mode, smooth UX, local/offline media playback, playlists, search, video playback features, and advanced options like PiP, subtitles, recommendations, and sleep timer.
architectural_notes: Choose one framework (Flutter or React Native) and build a single codebase targeting Android and iOS.
Use clean architecture with well-structured, commented code and performance/battery optimizations.
Support dark mode + light mode with a consistent minimal design system.

existing_features.title: Create a modern, clean, minimal responsive UI shell for a Music & Video Player with consistent design system: light + dark themes, soft neutral palette (avoid blue/purple), rounded corners, large clear icons, readable typography, smooth transitions, and a bottom navigation layout optimized for mobile screens.

Implement local media ingestion for audio and video via browser-safe mechanisms: allow user to add/select local files (file picker) and index them in an app library; persist library metadata locally for offline availability (metadata and user lists), without requiring uploads to the backend.
Build Music Player core playback UX: play/pause, next/previous, seek, shuffle, repeat (off/one/all), and a persistent mini-player bar that remains available while navigating between tabs.
Add playlists management: create, rename, delete playlists; add/remove tracks; play a playlist as a queue; store playlist definitions persistently.

Implement Favorites/Like and history tracking: like/unlike tracks, show a Favorites list, track Recently Played and Recently Added sections, and persist this data (local + per-user backend when signed in).
Add library search and sorting: search by song name/artist/album (best-effort based on available metadata), and sorting by name, size, and date for both audio and video lists.
Implement an equalizer using the Web Audio API with preset modes (e.g., Bass Boost, Pop, Rock, Classical, Jazz) and an Off mode; apply EQ to music playback only.
Build Video Player with local video playback, fullscreen mode, playback speed control (0.5x–2x), subtitle loading (e.g., .vtt), and Picture-in-Picture where supported by the browser.

Add mobile-friendly gesture controls for video playback: swipe gestures to adjust volume and brightness-like overlay (UI-level brightness simulation), with clear visual feedback and a way to disable gestures in settings.
Add smooth loading states and performance-minded UI patterns: skeletons/spinners for library indexing, virtualization for long lists, and ensure fast tab switching and low jank on mobile browsers.
Implement a sleep timer that stops playback after a user-selected duration (e.g., 5/10/15/30/60 minutes) with countdown display and cancel option.

Provide basic "smart recommendations" without external AI/LLM services: generate recommendations from on-device/user history (recently played, favorites, most played, similar artist/album when metadata exists).
Add authentication and per-user cloud sync for lightweight data only (playlists, favorites, history, settings) using Internet Identity; keep media files local-only.

Create in-repo documentation deliverables: (1) app UI wireframe description (screens + key interactions), (2) folder structure overview (frontend/backend), (3) basic starter code entry points explanation, (4) list of suggested libraries used (React Query, media helpers, etc.), and (5) future improvement ideas.
Add generated static image assets for branding and empty states and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated.

new_feature_requests.summary: Design system & UI shell: minimal clean UI, dark/light themes, rounded corners, smooth animations, bottom navigation, large icons, readable typography
Music playback core: play/pause/next/previous, shuffle/repeat, background playback, lock screen controls
Music library management: local/offline music access, search by song/artist/album, recently played, favorites/likes, recently added section
Equalizer: preset modes (Bass Boost, Pop, Rock, etc.)
Video playback core: play local videos, support MP4/MKV/AVI, fullscreen, auto-rotate
Video controls: gesture controls (brightness/volume), playback speed (0.5x–2x), subtitles support, Picture-in-Picture mode
Media organization: file sorting by size/name/date
Advanced UX: smooth loading animations, sleep timer
Smart recommendations: AI-based suggestions from user history

Project scaffolding deliverables: choose Flutter or React Native, clean architecture setup, responsive Android/iOS, optimized performance/low battery, folder structure, starter code, suggested libraries/plugins, future improvements list

Implement a Motoko backend data model and APIs to store per-user: playlists, liked tracks (by stable local track identifier), playback history, and basic settings; include basic CRUD methods and query methods needed by the UI.
